info.title: Traction Guest API
info.description:
The Traction Guest API is currently under limited release to select customers as we gather and iterate on feedback.

# Getting Started
If you are interested in getting early access to the API, please send us an email to [support@tractionguest.com](mailto:support@tractionguest.com).

We will also add you to our Slack channel where you can ask questions and get further help.

# Terms and Conditions
Please visit: [https://tractionguest.com/tos/api/](https://tractionguest.com/tos/api/)

# Versioning
This API follows [semantic versioning](https://semver.org/), which follows the `Major`.`Minor`.`Patch` format.

* The `Major` number increments when potentially incompatible changes are made.
* The `Minor` number increments when backwards-compatible additions are made.
* The `Patch` number increments when backwards-compatible bug-fixes are made.

/hosts.summary: Path used to manage the list of Hosts.
/hosts.description: The REST endpoint/path used to list and create zero or more `Host` entities.  This path contains a `GET` and `POST` operation to perform the list and create tasks, respectively.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Will filter by `first_name`, `last_name`, and `email`

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the results to a specified number, defaults to 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offsets the results to a specified number, defaults to 0

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of comma-separated related models to include

pagination.title: Pagination
pagination.description: The root of the Pagination type's schema.

last_id.description: The last ID rendered, if the request included the 'after_id' param.

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `Host` entities.

schema.title: ErrorsList
schema.description: A list of Errors that occured on the server

items.title: Error
items.description: The root of the Error type's schema.

domain.description: The name of the model with the error, or global if it is something outside a model

attribute.description: The model attribute where the error occured

code.description: An error code reference for the specific error that occured

message.description: A human readable error message that can be discarded for internationalization purposes

401.description: You don't have permission to view these Hosts

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets a list of all `Host` entities.

schema.title: HostCreateParams
schema.description: The params needed to create a new Host

schema.title: Host
schema.description: A client host assigned to a Signin

/email_templates.summary: Path used to manage the list of EmailTemplates.
/email_templates.description: The REST endpoint/path used to list zero or more `EmailTemplate` entities.  This path contains a `GET` operation to perform the list task.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the results to a specified number, defaults to 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offsets the results to a specified number, defaults to 0

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of comma-separated related models to include

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `EmailTemplate` entities.

401.description: You don't have permission to view this EmailTemplate

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets a list of all `EmailTemplate` entities.

/signins/{signin_id}.summary: Path used to manage a single Signin.
/signins/{signin_id}.description: The REST endpoint/path used to get single instances of an `Signin`.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of comma-separated related models to include

schema.title: SigninDetail
schema.description: The root of the Signin type's schema.

signin_acknowledgement.title: SigninAcknowledgement
signin_acknowledgement.description: The root of the SigninAcknowledgement type's schema.

is_signed_out.description: A one-way method of Signing out a Signin

is_acknowledged.description:
Whether this Signin has been acknowledged yet.
Can also be used as a one-way method of setting the Signin as acknowledged.

401.description: You don't have permission to view this Signin

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets the details of a single instance of a `Signin`.

requestBody.description:
The only updatable values for a `Signin` are `badge_number`, `badge_returned`, `is_accounted_for`, `is_signed_out`, and `is_acknowledged`. 
`is_signed_out` and `is_acknowledged` are pseudo attributes that once set to true, are irreversible.

is_signed_out.description: Used to sign out the `Signin`, can only be set to `true`.

is_acknowledged.description: Used to acknowledge the `Signin`, can only be set to `true`.

is_accounted_for.description: Used when keeping track of people in emergency situations

200.description: The Signin has been acknowledged, or signed out.

401.description: You don't have permission to update this Signin

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

422.description: Your request was not formatted correctly

/locations/{location_id}/invites.summary: Path used to manage a single Location's invites.
/locations/{location_id}/invites.description: The REST endpoint/path used to create single instances of an `Invite` for a specific `Location`.

schema.title: InviteCreateParams
schema.description: The root of the InviteCreateParams type's schema.

start_date.description: The `start_date` is required for invitations to lobbies

401.description: You don't have permission to create this Invite

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

422.description: Your request was not formatted correctly

/invites.summary: Path used to manage the list of Invites.
/invites.description: The REST endpoint/path used to list and create zero or more `Invite` entities.  This path contains a `GET` and `POST` operation to perform the list and create tasks, respectively.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the results to a specified number, defaults to 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offsets the results to a specified number, defaults to 0

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters by `first_name`, `last_name`, `company`, and `email`

parameters.name: with_colours
parameters.description:
A comma separated list of case-insensitive colour values.
i.e., `red`, `green`, `yellow`, and `orange`

parameters.name: location_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of Location IDs

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sorts by the field name and direction provided where the pattern is `FIELD_NAME_DIRECTION`

parameters.name: starts_before
parameters.description: Filters results to all those *before* the provided datetime

parameters.name: starts_after
parameters.description: Filters results to all those *after* the provided datetime

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of comma-separated related models to include

parameters.name: is_approved
parameters.description: True to return approved and auto approved invites, False to return pending and rejected invites

parameters.name: active_after
parameters.description: Checks that an invite hasn't yet started, or has started and is still active after a specified time

parameters.name: active_before
parameters.description: Checks that an invite hasn't ended before a specified time

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `Invite` entities.

401.description: You don't have permission to view these Invites

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets a list of all `Invite` entities.

/registrations/{registration_id}/invites.summary: Path used to create an `Invite` from `Registration` data.
/registrations/{registration_id}/invites.description: The REST endpoint/path used to create an instance of an `Invite`. This path contains a `POST` operation used to perform the create task.

201.description: Created an `Invite` from the given `Registration` UUID.

401.description: You don't have permission to create this Invite

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

422.description: Your request was not formatted correctly

post.summary: Create an Invite from a Registration

/signins.summary: Path used to manage the list of Signins.
/signins.description: The REST endpoint/path used to list and create zero or more `Signin` entities.  This path contains a `GET` and `POST` operation to perform the list and create tasks, respectively.

parameters.name: location_ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of Location IDs

parameters.name: with_colours
parameters.description:
A comma separated list of case-insensitive colour values.
i.e., `red`, `green`, `yellow`, and `orange`

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Allows you to query by `company`, `email`, `first_name`, `last_name`, and `location_name`

parameters.name: with_acknowledged
parameters.description: Filters to all those `Signin`s that have, or have not been acknowledged

parameters.name: with_signed_in
parameters.description: Filters to all `Signin`s that are, or are not currently signed out.

parameters.name: signin_before
parameters.description: Filters results to all those *before* the provided datetime

parameters.name: signin_after
parameters.description: Filters results to all those *after* the provided datetime

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the results to a specified number, defaults to 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offsets the results to a specified number, defaults to 0

parameters.name: query_sort
parameters.description: Allows you to override ordering by most relevant results when querying

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of comma-separated related models to include

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `Signin` entities.

401.description: You don't have permission to view these Signins

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets a list of all `Signin` entities.

signin_watchlist.title: SigninWatchlist
signin_watchlist.description: The root of the SigninWatchlist type's schema.

company.description: Company name, ignored if `registration_id` is included

last_name.description: Last name, ignored if `registration_id` is included

first_name.description: First name, ignored if `registration_id` is included

location_id.description: ID of the Location where the Signin happened, ignored if `registration_id` is included

host_ids.description: Array of Host ids, ignored if `registration_id` is included

requestBody.description: Params for creating a Signin can omit certain fields if a `registration_id` is present.

/invites/{invite_id}.summary: Path used to manage a single Invite.
/invites/{invite_id}.description: The REST endpoint/path used to get, update, and delete single instances of an `Invite`.  This path contains `GET`, `PUT`, and `DELETE` operations used to perform the get, update, and delete tasks, respectively.

schema.description: The root of the InviteDetail type's schema.

notification_triggers.description: List of scheduled notifications for an invite

items.title: NotificationTrigger
items.description: The root of the NotificationTrigger type's schema.

offset_direction.description: Whether the offset should be calculated for before, or after the event

offset_amount.description: The amount to offset the notification from the event

offset_origin.description: Whether the offset should be calculated from the start, or finish of the event

notification_groups.description: An array made of only `INVITEE`, `HOSTS, or `LEP` as possible string values

offset_unit.description: Whether the offset should be calculated as `days` or `hours`

email_template_name.description:
The name of the EmailTemplate associated with the NotificationTrigger.
This is only given from the server, not used as a create param.

/audit_logs.summary: Path used to manage the list of AuditLogs.
/audit_logs.description: The REST endpoint/path used to list zero or more `AuditLog` entities.  This path contains a `GET` operation to perform the list task.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the results to a specified number, defaults to 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offsets the results to a specified number, defaults to 0

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sorts by the field name and direction provided where the pattern is `FIELD_NAME_DIRECTION`

parameters.name: auditable_id
parameters.description: The unique ID of a model that has associated audit logs

parameters.name: auditable_type
parameters.description:
The name of the model that has associated audit logs. Valid values include:
- `user`
- `device_configuration`
- `signin`
- `invite`
- `watchlist_record`
- `account_preference`
- `signout`
- `host`
- `invite_watchlist`
- `location_preference`
- `parking_lot`
- `parking_stall`
- `permission_bundle`
- `person`
- `physical_access_grant`
- `physical_access_provider`
- `physical_access_rule`
- `security_badge_type`
- `signin_watchlist`
- `user_group_physical_access_rule`
- `visitor`
- `bulk_data_batch`

parameters.name: action_type
parameters.description:
The action performed by the user. Valid values include:
- `create`
- `update`
- `destroy`

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user who performed the database change

200.description: Successful response - returns an array of `AuditLog` entities.

401.description: You don't have permission to view this AuditLog

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets a list of all `AuditLog` entities.

format.description: The format type of the field

401.description: You don't have permission to view this AuditLog

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets the details of a single instance of an `AuditLog`.

get.summary: Get the capacity details for a location

200.description: Successful response returns the expected invites for the next N number of hours.

schema.title: CapacityForecast
schema.description: The root of the CapacityForecast's schema.

items.title: CapacityByHourResponse
items.description: The root of the CapacityByHour's schema.

401.description: You don't have permission to view the details of the location's capacity.

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets the details of the future capacity in a location.

parameters.name: hours_to_forecast
parameters.description: The next N number of hours, the data needs to be calculated. Range from 1 to 24. If not set, it defaults to 8.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: ISO8601 timestamp(includes the offset value) to use as the start point for the capacity estimate report. Defaults to the current local timestamp of the location if not provided. Eg: "2020-07-16T17:05:08-07:00"

get.summary: Get the current capacity details for a location

200.description: Successful response returns the current_signins and expected invites for the next hour.

schema.title: Capacity
schema.description: The root of the Capacity's schema.

401.description: You don't have permission to view the details of the location's capacity.

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Get details of current capacity in a location

get.summary: Get the details of a location

schema.title: Location
schema.description: The root of the Location type's schema.

401.description: You don't have permission to view this Location

403.description: You do not have permission for this action

get.description: Gets details of a single instance of `Location`.

parameters.name: location_ids
parameters.description:
A comma separated list of Location ids for filtering. i.e. '1,2,3'
Will return all packages from all locations if none are specified

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the results to a specified number, defaults to 50

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offsets the results to a specified number, defaults to 0

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of comma-separated related models to include. Possible values: 'recipient', 'location', 'image'

parameters.name: picked_up
parameters.description: Filters packages by their "picked_up" state..

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Searches for packages by recipient name

schema.title: Package
schema.description: Root for a Package type's schema

package_state.description: this can be one of the following states: 'processing', 'recipient_matched', 'needs_attention' or 'picked_up'

carrier_name.description: A carrier name that gets detected on the shipping label. i.e. USPS, Purolator, DHL, Canada Post, Royal Mail, etc...

post.description: Creates a [Package] entity by extracting information about the recipient and carrier from the given image file.

schema.title: PackageCreateParams.v1
schema.description: A [base64_image] string is provided as an encoded image of a shipping label. The image will be processed to determine the package's intended recipient. If a match is found between the recipient and an existing host, they'll be notified about the arrival of their package at the [location_id] specified.

base64_image.description: Base64 encoded image on which to perform processing

location_id.description: Location id for where the package was delivered

get.description: Gets the details of a single instance of a Package

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: A list of comma-separated related models to include

put.description:
Update/Edit information about a Package.

picked_up - changes the package_state to picked up and assigns non null value to picked_up_at

recipient_id - update the package's intended recipient. Changes package_state to 'recipient_matched' if a match hasn't been found and notifies host about their package via email. A previous recipient will stop getting notifications

carrier_name - change/update the package's carrier/courier information

schema.title: PackageUpdateParams.v1
schema.description:
Update/Edit information about a Package.

[picked_up] - changes the package_state to picked up and assigns non null value to picked_up_at

[recipient_id] - update the package's intended recipient. Changes package_state to 'recipient_matched' and notifies host about their package via email. A previous recipient will stop getting notifications

[carrier_name] - change/update the package's carrier/courier information

picked_up.description: changes the package_state to picked up and assigns non null value to picked_up_at

recipient_id.description: id of the Host for which you want to send notifications to regarding their package

idempotencyKey.name: Idempotency-Key
idempotencyKey.description: An optional idempotency key to allow for repeat API requests. Any API request with this key will only be executed once, no matter how many times it's submitted. We store idempotency keys for only 24 hours. Any `Idempotency-Key` shorter than 10 characters will be ignored
